titleStmt.title: Untitled [The Duke and Duchess of Portland and a party of friends]
titleStmt.sponsor: This project is supported in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and the Geraldine W. & Robert J. Dellenback Foundation.

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

notesStmt.note: In 1892 the Duke and Duchess of Portland were William John Arthur Charles James Cavendish-Bentinck (1857-1943), 6th Duke of Portland, and Winifred Anna Dallas-Yorke Cavendish-Bentinck (1863-1954).

bibl.title: Untitled [The Duke and Duchess of Portland and a party of friends]
Daily Chronicle

msIdentifier.repository: McCracken Research Library, Buffalo Bill Center of the West, William F. "Buffalo Bill" Cody Collection, MS6

keywords.term: Buffalo Bill's Wild West in Britain

revisionDesc.change: Zierlein, Kim Clark, L. Christianson, Frank Hanna, S. Proofreading

div1.p: The Duke and Duchess of Portland and a party of friends visited the Horticultural Exhibition yesterday afternoon, and afterwards witnessed the performance of Buffalo Bill's "Wild West." Some interest was attached to the appearance in a private box of a portion of the band of the South American Gauchos, who are to make their first appearance this afternoon.
The Cossacks engaged at the Wild West Show are to give a performance before the Queen and Court at Windsor Castle on Saturday afternoon.
